intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium imparisquamum, commonly known as the unequal-squamate hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, and its seeds are dispersed by wind. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
